column4: Ubuntu does not detect my harddrive, "sudo fdisk -l" shows nothing, how can I install?
which controller is it attached to? can you see it on boot messages (dmesg) ?
how would I find those things out?
dmesg | less to see kernel boot up msgs. "lspci" shows the controllers cards on the computer you can paste it on paste.ubuntu.com
I am using the CTRL-ALT-F2 terminal, so I cant paste, but lscpi mentions "SATA IDE Controllers"
use pastebinit like shey said
it couldnt find the package
running off of the LiveCD atm
:| which kind of ide controler? intel; sis; via etc...
intel
did you look into dmesg output? intel controllers are well supported
running in command-line atm, the output is longer than the screen, nothing that I can see says anything relevant though
thats what pagers were programmed for use "dmesg | less" and use spc bar to move
there are a few mentions of ata and scsi, what should I be looking for?
if the controller is intel somehing like ata_piix or ahci (lines beggining with)
there doesnt seem to be any mention of my hdd, it does mention my cdrom though
the cdrom is connected to the older drive-connection (I forgot name, the one with the wide cables)
ParalelATA vs SerialATA :). well i would recommend to check the bios and puth the sata controller in ahci mode if you can
its an option has an option for AHCI, its currently set to disabled, Is their any risk to the data on that drive by changing the setting?
no; just changes the mode the sata controller is used by the drivers
its working now, thank you
